sn23.3:4.2: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:
sn23.3:4.3: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘the attachment to being reborn’.
sn23.3:4.4: What is the attachment to being reborn? And what is the cessation of the attachment to being reborn?”
sn23.3:4.5: “Rādha, any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for form; and any attraction, grasping, mental resolve, insistence, and tendencies—
sn23.3:4.6: this is called the attachment to being reborn.
sn23.3:4.7: Their cessation is the cessation of the attachment to being reborn.
sn23.3:4.8: Any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for feeling …
sn23.3:4.11: consciousness; and any becoming involved, grasping, mental decisions, insistence, and tendencies—
sn23.3:4.13: this is called the attachment to being reborn.
sn23.3:4.14: Their cessation is the cessation of the attachment to being reborn.”
